comment: Very passionate about what she teaches! Discussion posts due every week which can suck but she gives great feedback on how to improve for next time. Two tests in class, the midterm and the final. Quizzes due after every reading. Attendance policy is pretty strict but you miss a lot of information if you miss a class anyway. Loved her!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: All of her tests are based off of lecture. She does have pop quizzes based off the reading we do, so ALWAYS READ AND NEVER SKIP CLASS! She only drops one quiz grade. She's really funny and helps you understand all the reading. I'm horrible in English, but I did well in her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Super funny and nice lady. Lecture is based off of reading, tests based off of lectures, with a few pop quizzes thrown in, so it's a good idea to go class and you won't have to do much outside of class. She's hilarious and makes tough reading comprehensible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor! She is kind, caring, and has a sense of humor. Your grade is made up of a few reading homework quizzes and 4 essays. She is a bit of a tough grader but gives an extra credit option for each essay. She is very pleasant and makes the class worth taking. Definitely would take her again!

Expect to take quizzes almost every class period on the reading. If you read the material, you'll do well on the quizzes.  A great professor with a great style. Attendance is mandatory. Clear grading criteria. One paper, one group project, 10 or more quizzes (one drops) a midterm and a final concludes your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. K is brilliant with an obvious passion for knowledge that makes her class a joy to take. She's a tough grader, but she gives occasional extra credit in the form of dropped quiz grades. You'll have quizzes on the reading at random, but she picks out great texts and gives amazing lectures. There's a midterm, a final, an essay, and a group project
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Tough for an 1101 class. Grade based heavily on 4 essays. Dosen't help much with essays until she grades them. Interesting class discussions but dry essay topics. She's a great lecturer and keeps the class lively.

Not sure I have many positive things to say. Classes are not enjoyable, groups discussions are a miserable free. Papers are all on dry, overworked subjects. If you are actually interested in what is going on in the world, don't expect to get to explore that interest in this class. I would not take her again.

There's a quiz every week and the textbook readings are necessary. She basically makes you do an in-class assignment or group project every class, but it's very helpful and I learned a lot. She is also very unbiased and understanding, and her lectures are fun to listen to, but a lot of information is covered.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Super nice and super funny. Reading are usually fairly short and manageable. GO TO CLASS because tests are based on in-class notes and she doesn't post them. Overall easy class if you do the reading assignments and go to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Kuykendal is one of the best professors I have ever had. Plenty of reading to do but I never have to worry if I don't understand something because her lectures elaborate super well on each text. Tests are straight from the class notes. She makes this class enjoyable by the activities she plans and good attitude she always brings to class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Kuykendal is a great teacher. She's funny, quirky, and entertaining to listen too. The class before a test is called an "exam review" and class is optional. You can earn up to 5 extra credit points for every test by going to this "review" and writing a short response to a question she puts up. Her test are STRAIGHT FROM THE NOTES.  Easy A

She knows what shes talking about so lectures and notes arent horrible. Be ware of pop quizzes on the reading the night before at least once a week. She is willing to help you whenever you need help. She gives extra credit assignment the day before the test and its an essay worth 5 points that is optional. There is also a writing & group assignment
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A lot of assigned reading but I just read the summaries to make the pop quizzes easy. Had to come to class to take notes bc she wont put them online but she makes lectures interesting with her humor. Also,tests are super simple and straight from the notes. Apparently, her smaller classes the dynamic is much different and more difficult. Made an A.

Prof K is a great professor. TAKE HER TAKE HER!!!!! She makes class interesting, even if the text you are reading isn't. She is so passionate about her class and it makes everything more enjoyable. Tests are straightforward from the notes and reading quizzes are simple if you read (or spark note :) )

Four essays; minimum 5 pages for some, min. 7 for others. Gives extra credit on each paper if you go to the writing center. Leaves room for creativity in papers. Absolutely hysterical. Definitely have to work for the A, but her class is worth it. I would take her class over and over again if I could.

She is very engaging, knows what she's talking about, and will intellectually push you during the daily class discussions. Great class, great professor. I would gladly ask for her as a professor again.
She gives a lot of extra credit and lectures are thorough and interesting. Easy A if you read and pay attention in class. 3 tests, a group project, and easy quizzes over the reading throughout.

Prof Kuykendal is absolutely amazing. She always had the best lectures, and was super fun in class. We watched Silence of the Lambs in class at one point in the semester. Tests are literally straight from the notes no surprises, and there are easy pop quizzes over the reading if you read. One paper the whole semester and tons of EC, TAKE HER!!!
This is my third year in college and I absolutely love this professor. I have learned so much information from her  through her lectures without feeling overwhelmed or failing anything. Super easy!!!
All readings are out of the textbook. Don't forget her D2L quizzes and always go to the writing center for your essays. Loved her! However, she's a stickler for attendance.

Pros:  -  maymester    -She gives great notes  -Tests are from the notes ( no surprises) -We wrote journals everyday (easy) -drops lowest journalquiz grade -funny Cons: 2 quizzes a day 4-5 questions (easy to fail if you miss one) -Lots of reading

Professor Kuykendal is a nice lady, but the class itself is boring. You have to read a story from the book before each class meeting and usually have a quiz(multiple choice or a writing response). The 1st couple quizzes were tricky. You really have to pay attention when you read. Tests are surprisingly easy though. Take her. Just make sure to read.

To actually enjoy going to an English Class for the teacher is one thing I never thought I would say. She is an EXCELLENT teacher and i would DEFINITELY take her AGAIN. She is hilarious when it comes to class discussions (which is part of your participation grade) and an influential teacher when aiding your essays. TAKE TAKE TAKE HER!!!!:)

Had Kuykendal for 2110 this past semester. I can honestly say that I really enjoyed her class & I didn't think I would.  Attendance isn't mandatory but she includes lecture material in tests so I wouldn't advise skipping. She is a fan of pop quizzes so READ before class, the readings aren't long.  If you have the option, take world lit with her!

I took her ENGL 2110 class as a Maymester and loved her! She definitely keeps you entertained-which can be seriously hard to do when it's an all day class! A little outside reading, no papers, and all work was done in class. She explains things extremely well and truly wants to help you learn! Seriously disappointed she doesn't teach more courses!

Kuykendal is awesome. Class is spent copying notes and doing in class writing assignments. There's some easy group work. Reading is required to pass almost daily reading quizzes or short responses. 3 exams 20% each, 2pg paper 25%, 16 quizzesshort writing 15%.  Exams are 35 question 3-choice scantron, easy and straight from notes only. Take her.

This is my FAVORITE professor thus far. She is enthusiastic, passionate, quirkily funny, and an incredibly dedicated prof. Our in-class discussions were fascinating, and she helped me develop my writing style even more. If you are dedicated to the class, you will get a good grade! I'm also taking her next semester for ENGL 1102, I loved it so much!

Super easy class. My class took 15 quizzes (some are four-question, multiple choice quizzes, the others are a short free response). I hated the quizzes because if you miss one, it's a 75. BUT, her tests are word-for-word from the notes, so write down everything she writes down. It's an enjoyable class. Just read, and study the notes, you'll be fine

You have to read before almost every class. Readings are SUPER short. You have random quizzes over what you read but they are easy and ask about general details. Random class assignments also go in that grade category. 3 tests and a final; tests come directly from the notes that she types. She's also pretty quirky and fun. Take her for an easy A

She's really passionate about literature. It's really refreshing to have a professor as steeped in literature as she is. Class attendance isn't mandatory, but she does give random quizzes over the reading material, and those add up. How she hasn't gotten the hot rating until now, I have no clue!

Dr. Kuykendal really cares about her students.I just took her for a maymester. I was really challenged to write and furthermore enhance my skills in writing but Dr. Kuykendal really helped me enhance my writing. She will make you work hard for your grade but shes not a harsh grader. Very fair lady witty . Absolutely very knowledgeable about English

FAVORITE PROFESSOR AT KSU. Professor Kuykendal is witty, smart, and keeps the class discussion lively and moving. She gives helpful feedback on essays and truly wants her students to succeed. She's a tough grader, but she teaches you how to become a better writer. Take her if you have an opportunity!!
She is perhaps one of the best English professors I have ever had yet, she's very pretty and very laid back. I'm taking her again for World Literature!

Dr. Kuykendal is funny and a good teacher. Her notes are clear and you always know exactly what she expects. She's also very nice and definitely knows what she's talking about. Half the class was usually lecture and the other half group discussion. One project, two tests

She was okay... VERY sarcastic. We wrote 3 papers about one topic and then used them to write a huge research paper at the end of the semester. No final exam and the lowest quiz is dropped. We use the textbook to read before quizzes before almost every class. She's a tough grader and it was pretty hard to get a high B. So... take at your own risk!!

Although her material is difficult, she is really passionate and does her best to keep the class intresting. It is not an easy a class however I would tak eher again over getting an A because I enjoyed her class and she made me want to learn

I Loved her! She is very funny. She keeps the class entertaining. there are weekly quizzes, so i would recommend going to class. and reading the text! There is one paper and you use the book to write it.

Dr. K. is a really interesting teacher, but if you want to focus on analyzing the works, this might not be the class for you. All we ever did was talk about cultural context. In addition, she didn't really require much critical thinking; everything was laid out and included in her lecture for you. This class was so easy it was almost a joke.

If only I had more space to write! She's one of those professors that comes along every once in a while and changes your life. In a few words, Inspiring, Entertaining, Energetic, Loves what she does, Charismatic, and being relatively pretty is just icing on the cake! I would take this class over again and again.

She is an excellent professor with a good sense of humor. Attendance isn't mandatory but there are pop quizzes once a week. Her test are very easy because they are comprised of everything that was covered in the lecture. Come to class and pay attention and you will definitely pass!

I took this class over the summer, one of the easiest English classes ever if you actually study the required readings and take notes. There are 3 tests, short essay on 1 of the required readings and quizzes. Tests are easy; it covers her handouts/notes. If you want a class that you will be interested in, definitely TAKE HER! :)

She's pretty funny and witty. This was the easiest English class I have taken. Required a bit of reading, but not hard at all. Weekly quizzes were a killer, no makeup and are given within the first 5 mins of class. They didnt count for much so not stressful at all. Tests were super easy.

I voluntarily took both Composition 1101 and 1102 with her. She is super funny, witty, and definitely knows what she is teaching. Don't take her class expecting an easy A, however. She does require work (gasp!) from you. A lot of writing, not very much reading. I would highly recommend her if you actually want to learn.

I took her for World lit and she's absolutely amazing. 1 paper, random pop quizzes but they're once a week. Her tests are exactly from the notes. She's understanding. I missed a quiz for a funeral and she let me retake quiz. grades fair, wants to help. She's amazing and funny. I'd recommend her to anyone!

You must have the book to this class! All her quizzes are off readings from that book. There are 4 papers in her class. She is NOT hard & very nice. If you try, you will do well. She takes class very seriously!! Show up! Attendance is important.
fun class if you pay attention and take the notes! You will not pass the exams if you do not. You can find some of the textbooks online for free without buying them in the bookstore.

to be honest, I built my entire schedule around taking this class because of what I had read on this site, and I deeply regretted it. grades consist of two journals and three papers. she'll tell you the journal is casual, then grade you harsh if it's not detailed enough. and the website she uses to upload papers ALWAYS messes up. not worth it!

Easily my favorite professor, She's very relatable and understanding. Her assignments aren't that difficult to write about. There is a mandatory attendance policy though. I hate English classes, but love hers. I would definitely take her again.

Dr. Kuykendal is great! I struggle with writing papers, and I somehow pulled an A. She has papers that are easy to write about. You get two extra credit point on every paper if you go to the writing lab. Also, discussions are important in class. Make sure you contribute. Overall, great teacher!!

Dr. Kuykendal is wonderful! She makes English fun, her classes are strictly discussion based off the previous night's reading. She grades fairly based on how much effort you put into your work and if you follow her guidelines clearly. I would highly recommend her to anyone! 4 essays that branch off of one another! Easy A if you put in the effort!

I don't ever get A's on college papers, but in her class I did! Not because she was easy, but because she helped bring out the writer in me. Her assignments are easy to understand and I had a lot of fun writing for this class. It was a real eye-opening experience for me and I definitely recommend her!
This is a great teacher. Just attend class, and do your quizes online and make sure you do your papers, and you'll get an easy A

I absolutely love Dr. Kuykendal.  She is passionate about the material taught and discussions in class are very interesting.  If you attend class, read the material you will do great in her class.  She does take attendance and hates when people use their cell phones in class. I highly recommend her as a professor if you get the chance.

I absolutely hate english but I loved her class. She is very clear on what she expects in her papers and is always willing to help. Mostly a discussion class and she makes it fun. There are 3 papers, 2 journals and weekly online quizzes. The quizzes are open book and easy. I highly recommend taking her class. I look forward to going to her class.

GET HER IF YOU CAN! best professor there is! i HATE English, i HATE reading, i HATE writing. she makes class fun. its more of a discussion class so you talk all class and have little on line quizzes each night, super easy. shes awesome and a fair grader. 2 easy journals and 3 essays thats it.

great teacher! always willing to help. makes directions clear. theres never a guess to what will you will be learning in class because she follows her syllabus perfectly! never missed a day of class. and clearly loves to teach!

I love her! She is so helpful. If you read your assignments and do well on the online quizzes, you will do well in the class. She is so funny, and so laid back. I actually looked forward to attending class at 9:30 am.

Dr. Kuykendal is by far my favorite professor here at KSU. I have taken her for 1101,1102,and 2110. There is one paper at the beginning, a midterm, and a final. Also open book, not timed online quizzes. Go to class and pay attention, I promise you will enjoy her class! I am sad that this will be my last time taking her. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!

She's great! I'm an English Ed major and it's refreshing to see someone as passionate as I am. I highly recommend. Lots of book use, 3 papers, no final!! Gladly answers questions thoroughly. I'm taking her again for 1102!
She's a really great teacher and you can tell she loves what she does.

Dr. Kuykendal is the best! Def. one of my fave professors at KSU! Coming from disliking my AP English classes in high school to having a blast in her class- I would highly recommend her! She makes class fun & you actually want to come to it! She's hilarious & you learn so much! Take notes, do the online quizzes & read - & you're guaranteed an A! [:
If you are looking for an easy class, DO NOT TAKE HER! She takes the class extremely  serious. She has never been clear on the subject we're suppose to write about...

ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PROFESSOR. I have had her for ENGL 1101, 1102, and in the fall I am taking her for American Lit. She makes class interesting and class is enjoyable to go to. Four papers total with weekly open book quizzes online. Papers are easy if you follow the rubric. You can get an A easily. No final. Class wide debates. So much fun!!

Took her for both 1101 and 1102. Absolutely HILARIOUS. Shes witty and makes learning the guidelines interesting. Follow her paper guidelines and you can get an A. Also- participate in class. She likes when you actually care. Take her, highly recommended.

Great teacher. Had her for 1101 and hoping to get her again. Very clear on instructions and extremely nice and helpful. Would definitely recommend. Yes, you have to do the work but its nothing too difficult. Makes class enjoyable.
Great teacher.  Very easy and you know what you are supposed to do.  She is fun and will always help you with questions.  A total of 4 essays and easy weekly quizzes online every week.
